snippet: Andrew Hamblin, a snake-handling minister and a reality television star, described his not-guilty plea on Friday to a wildlife-possession charge as a “fight for freedom of religion.”
abstract: Andrew Hamblin, snake-handling minister and reality television star in Tennessee, pleads not guilty to illegally keeping dozens of poisonous snakes that he and his congregants routinely touch during worship services; describes his not-guilty plea as 'fight for freedom of religion;' to Hamblin and his supporters, case is little more than state-instigated discrimination against a religious practice that has been present in East Tennessee for more than a century.
lead_paragraph: Andrew Hamblin, a snake-handling minister and a reality television star, described his not-guilty plea on Friday to a wildlife-possession charge as a “fight for freedom of religion.”

headline.main: Tennessee Pastor Disputes Wildlife Possession Charge by State
headline.print_headline: Asserting a God-Given Right to Snakes
